text: The conversation started with a PostgreSQL connection error message indicating that the server is not running or accepting TCP/IP connections. A Neo4j connection also failed due to the same issue. Both errors resulted in an "Network is unreachable" error, suggesting that there are connectivity problems affecting both databases.
content:
USER: [{'tool_use_id': 'toolu_01RHuv5Be53ccVUy8V6qBjfu', 'type': 'tool_result', 'content': '2025-12-29 12:23:03,405 - ERROR - ✗ PostgreSQL connection failed: connection to server at "100.110.82.181", port 5433 failed: Network is unreachable

Failed to establish connection to ResolvedIPv4Address(('100.110.82.181', 8687)) (reason [Errno 101] Network is unreachable)
2025-12-29 12:23:03,405 - ERROR - Failed to connect to databases', 'is_error': False}]

sentiment.analysis: The sentiment of this conversation is 1 (very negative). The user is experiencing issues with connecting to PostgreSQL and Neo4j servers, which indicates a problematic situation. The error messages suggest that the network is unreachable, adding to the negative tone of the conversation.
